channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12529] Use ThreadLocalRandom for RandomQueueBalancer
item.description: looks like the Random in RandomQueueBalancer is now the main cause of contention in the rpc queue insertion. we should replace that Random with a ThreadLocalRandom.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: +1 Was going to go through our code base and see where we could use this java7 feature in place of expensive new Randoms. Thanks Matteo Bertozzi
JDK 6 is still supported by 0.98 so we can't use ThreadLocalRandom there.
Of course we can make and use our own thread local Randoms. It won't be as nice as the concurrent version in JDK 7 but should work.

I just realized that RwQueueRpcExecutor has the same Random usage. so v2 moves the QueueBalancer to the base RpcExecutor class (the class was private to the BalancedQueueRpcExecutor)
